0: Fruits and vegetables are important components of a healthy diet. Reduced fruit and vegetable consumption is linked to poor health and increased risk of noncommunicable diseases (NCDs). An estimated 5.2 million deaths worldwide were attributable to inadequate fruit and vegetable consumption in 2013. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Including fruits and vegetables as part of the daily diet may reduce the risk of some NCDs including cardiovascular diseases and certain types of cancer. More limited evidence suggests that when consumed as part of a healthy diet low in fat, sugars and salt/sodium, fruits and vegetables may also help to prevent weight gain and reduce the risk of obesity, an independent risk-factor for NCDs. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Moreover, fruits and vegetables are rich sources of vitamins and minerals, dietary fibre and a host of beneficial non-nutrient substances including plant sterols, flavonoids and other antioxidants and consuming a variety of fruits and vegetables helps to ensure an adequate intake of many of these essential nutrients. an NEWLINE_CHAR may may healthy types of vegetables fruits salt/sodium, many and NEWLINE_CHAR certain health of and NEWLINE_CHAR An other and NEWLINE_CHAR of and is obesity, are and and in to healthy may certain and of a increased in are noncommunicable
